content: every time I want to ping the iCE breakers, I have two problems. 1. I have to remember the name of the team (@centril mentioned this as an issue for the cleanup-crew on discord, see related triagebot issue, and 2. I have to remember the syntax for the ping message in question.
When I try to resolve this by googling for "LLVM ICE breakers", this is the first link: https://blog.rust-lang.org/inside-rust/2019/10/22/LLVM-ICE-breakers.html
That page is advertising the teams, but its aimed at people who might want to join the team. It doesn't help me when I want to notify them.
Now, I know we cannot change Google. maybe we could change the metadata for our pages. But I have a simpler solution: Can you modify the text of the blog post to link to the right place(s)?
1. should be simpler soon; @rustbot ping cleanup
@nikomatsakis ^ ?
I guess maybe I could just submit a PR to the blog.rust-lang.org repo?

centril said:

  1. should be simpler soon; @rustbot ping cleanup

yes I did link to the triagebot issue
just commented that I'm not sure if a lot of aliases to cleanup are better :)
that may be a bit confusing
maybe just one alias is enough?
cleanup
@Santiago Pastorino replied; why do you think it would be confusing?
I guess seeing one time ping shrink, another time ping cleanup and so on it may make it harder to remember
given that the group name is cleanup crew I guess just cleanup is enough
if you remember one over the other then any of them should work :slight_smile:
I personally don't associate what the group does with "cleanup", so one of the other is more memorable for me
:+1:, not really important, if it's better for you then it's good :)

1. I have to remember the syntax for the ping message in question.

Something that might help would be to use the GitHub Saved Replies feature to store that message. You then just pick it from the dropdown when you want to ping the team.
in any case, I went ahead and added the links I suggested (see https://github.com/rust-lang/blog.rust-lang.org/pull/543 )
